etymologies: late 15th century; earliest use found in Chaucer's Canterbury Tales. From classical Latin arrogantia arrogance; compare -ancy

definitions: Arrogance; the fact or quality of being arrogant.

notes.text: After the mid 17th century, much less common than arrogance.

definitions: An instance of being arrogant; an arrogant act, assumption, utterance, etc.
